vegetables.Name: Carrot
vegetables.Description: Carrot is a root vegetable, typically orange in color, though there are purple, red, yellow, and white varieties. It is known for its crisp texture and high nutritional content, especially rich in beta-carotene, fiber, and vitamins.
vegetables.Flowers: White, umbrella-shaped flowers only in the second year if allowed to grow (biennial cycle).
vegetables.Cycle: Biennial (typically harvested in the first year, before flowering).
vegetables.Maintenance: Low; requires regular watering, weed control, and occasional fertilization.
vegetables.Growth_rate: Moderate; carrots are usually ready for harvest in 70 to 80 days after planting.
vegetables.Fruit: N/A (Carrots are harvested for their roots, and if left to seed in the second year, they produce small seeds instead of fruit).
vegetables.Depth_water_requirement: 15–25 cm (6–10 inches) to ensure even moisture at root depth.
vegetables.Volume_water_requirement: Moderate, requiring about 25-35 mm of water per week.
vegetables.Watering_period: Water once every 5–7 days or when the top 2 cm of soil is dry.
vegetables.Watering_general_benchmark: Keep soil consistently moist but avoid waterlogging. Mulching helps retain soil moisture.
vegetables.Wymiary: Plants grow to about 30 cm (12 inches) tall; the root can grow up to 25 cm (10 inches) long.
vegetables.Sunlight: Full sun to partial shade (minimum 6 hours of sunlight per day).
vegetables.Edible_parts: Root (primary edible part, can be eaten raw or cooked).

vegetables.Name: Tomato
vegetables.Description: Tomato is a widely grown fruit vegetable, commonly red in color, but there are also yellow, green, and purple varieties. It is rich in antioxidants like lycopene and vitamins C and K.
vegetables.Flowers: Small, yellow flowers appear before the fruit starts forming.
vegetables.Maintenance: Moderate; requires regular watering, staking, and protection from pests.
vegetables.Growth_rate: Fast; tomatoes can be harvested within 60-80 days after planting.
vegetables.Fruit: Round or oblong, varying in size and color depending on the variety.
vegetables.Depth_water_requirement: 30–45 cm (12–18 inches) to ensure even moisture at root depth.
vegetables.Volume_water_requirement: High, requiring about 35-50 mm of water per week.
vegetables.Watering_period: Water every 2-3 days, especially during dry spells.
vegetables.Watering_general_benchmark: Keep the soil consistently moist, avoid dry spells and waterlogging.
vegetables.Wymiary: Plants can grow up to 2 meters (6.5 feet) tall.
vegetables.Sunlight: Full sun (requires at least 6-8 hours of sunlight per day).
vegetables.Edible_parts: Fruit (commonly eaten raw, cooked, or processed).
